author: stephlocke
body:
PowerShell 5 now supports native (de)compression of zip files. It would be great if this could be extended to include:
- .tar
- .gz
- .lzma / .7z
- .bz2


Ideally, this would function recursively so formats like .tar.gz get decompressed or created.  

This would make PowerShell better at handling archives from multiple systems.

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
Great suggestion!
Per #1979 we are working on consuming the Archive module from it's own repo https://github.com/PowerShell/Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive

Can you, please, open an issue there?

title: Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive Cmdlets should work on typical linux compression formats
